did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Gail and Stephen Rudin New York landmarks collection, 1835-1944.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Paper ephemera, postcards, and photographs related to the Brooklyn Bridge and other New York landmarks. Includes booklet, program, invitation, and ticket to opening ceremony for bridge on May 24, 1883. Also includes receipt for the purchase of Randall's Island, as well as miscellany related to the Holland Tunnel and the Statue of Liberty.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Paper ephemera, postcards, and photographs related to the Brooklyn Bridge and other New York landmarks. Includes booklet, program, invitation, and ticket to opening ceremony for bridge on May 24, 1883. Also includes receipt for the purchase of Randall's Island, as well as miscellany related to the Holland Tunnel and the Statue of Liberty.

controlaccess.head: Places:
controlaccess.geogname: Holland Tunnel (Jersey City, N.J., and New York, N.Y.)
Statue of Liberty National Monument (N.Y. and N.J.)

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Gail and Stephen Rudin New York landmarks collection, #6991. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

emph.ref: Series II. Other New York Landmarks

did.unittitle: Series I. Brooklyn Bridge
Stranahan, James S.T.

scopecontent.p:
Signature of the President of Brooklyn Park Board; Father of the Brooklyn Bridge.
Rudin # M-45A

did.unittitle: "Pneumatic Tower Foundations of the East River Suspension Bridge", by W.A. Roebling.

scopecontent.p:
With folding plates.
Rudin # M-46

did.unittitle: Opening day souvenir booklet.

scopecontent.p: Rudin # M-47

did.unittitle: Brooklyn Bridge pass

scopecontent.p:
"Pass the bearer and friends over the Bridge at all times", signed by William Kingsley.
Rudin # M-47A

did.unittitle: Opening ceremonies program

scopecontent.p:
"Opening Ceremonies of New York and Brooklyn Bridge" - Program. With Brooklyn Bridge First Day Cover and Brooklyn Bridge Maximum Card.
Rudin # M-48

did.unittitle: Official invitation for the Opening Ceremonies of the New York and Brooklyn Bridge.

scopecontent.p: Rudin # M-49

did.unittitle: Ticket to the Opening Ceremonies of the New York and Brooklyn Bridge.

scopecontent.p: Rudin # M-50

did.unittitle: Advertising envelope with engraving of Brooklyn Bridge.

scopecontent.p: Rudin # M-51A

did.unittitle: Newspaper

scopecontent.p:
"The Herald" - Omaha: "Brooklyn's Bridge. Opening of the New Link Between the Two Great Cities…" Describes festivities and political events surrounding the opening.
Rudin # M-51

did.unittitle: Two albumen photos of the Brooklyn Bridge.

scopecontent.p: Rudin # M-52B

did.unittitle: Six New York and Brooklyn Bridge railroad and promenade tickets

scopecontent.p: Rudin # M-53

did.unittitle: Roebling letterhead

scopecontent.p:
Ornate pictorial letterhead (of Brooklyn Bridge) with stylized typography, including Roebling correspondence regarding legal matters. Signed in type.
Rudin # M-53A

did.unittitle: Five philatelic envelopes and one woodcut relating to the Brooklyn Bridge.

scopecontent.p: Rudin # M-54A

did.unittitle: Magnus print of "New York, Brooklyn and Williamsburg".

scopecontent.p: Rudin # M-54B

did.unittitle: Postcard collection of Brooklyn Bridge images.

scopecontent.p: Rudin # M-54C

did.unittitle: New York City map.

scopecontent.p:
Map of New York with portions of Brooklyn and Jersey City, including Brooklyn Bridge location.
Rudin # M-50B

did.unittitle: Photograph

scopecontent.p:
The "Great Bridge" - Image probably taken soon after bridge was completed.
Rudin # M-52

did.unittitle: Panorama viewing set

scopecontent.p:
Box cut with magnifying lens. Contains 11 views of Brooklyn Bridge, etc.
Rudin # M-50A

did.unittitle: Engraving

scopecontent.p:
Period engraving of Brooklyn Bridge soon after it opened.
Rudin # M-52C

did.unittitle: Series II. Other New York Landmarks
Randall's Island purchase

scopecontent.p:
Receipt for the purchase of Randall's Island by the City of New York for $60,000.
Rudin # M-91

did.unittitle: Holland Tunnel Invitation, Ticket, and Envelope

scopecontent.p: Rudin # M-93

did.unittitle: Dedicating the Statue of Liberty

scopecontent.p:
Two pieces: Engraved image of the Statue of Liberty inviting the bearer to the inauguration by the President; Rare steamboat ticket for passage and admission to the platform at the event. See also Bartholdi and Pulitzer letters, Rudin #s A-7, A-8, A-8A, and A-191 in the Gail and Stephen Rudin Autograph Collection, collection #6875.
Rudin # M-103

did.unittitle: Statue of Liberty stamps and coins

scopecontent.p:
Folder containing eleven stamps and four coins commemorating the 125th anniversary of the Statue of Liberty.
Rudin # M-104

list.head: Books
list.item: Brooklyn Bridge 1883-1933. A valuable history published to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the Brooklyn Bridge. First Edition.
Opening Ceremonies of the New York and Brooklyn Bridge. 1883. Inscribed on flyleaf by Emily Warren Roebling, wife of Chief Engineer Washington Roebling. Rudin # M-48A

The New York City Subway: Its Construction and Equipment. Inscription reads "Presented to Alderman John H. Dougherty, by August Belmont, Esq. President, Interborough Rapid Transit Company, November 21st, 1904". Rudin # M-94
